intro: Brittonastrum pallidiflorum, commonly known as the paleflower brittlestem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of whitish hairs. Brittonastrum pallidiflorum is a relatively rare species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
